1036.60.text:

1038.67.text:

to match the National Rifle

1041.31.text:

1089.79.text:

1137.30.text:

The criminal was standing

1146.28.text:

1157.39.text:

1163.73.text:

1186.59.text:

1191.69.text:

1193.79.text:
Children living in

1196.20.text:

1198.93.text: is a daily part of life.

1201.33.text:
>>>RONNIE ELDRIDGE: When

1203.74.text:
especially their expectation
of a life span is very short

1208.54.text:
>>>LEAH GUNN BARRETT: It
is. We have an interesting

1210.54.text:

working in schools in

1212.75.text:

and this year we're going

1216.08.text:

We're working with high school

1219.39.text:

which we call Reaction,

1221.79.text:
which was actually named by
the students because it's

1224.49.text:

in their communities.

1227.19.text:
And we train them over half
a year or a whole year to

1231.10.text:
become advocates. So they can't
move from where they live

1235.07.text:
but they can actually try
to make their communities

1237.64.text:

knowing who to contact if

1240.87.text:

1243.38.text:
to go visit both local and

1247.28.text:

public speaking. What the

1251.15.text:
laws are here in New York
and federally, where we

1253.52.text:
need to tighten them and
gun trafficking is a real

1256.12.text:
concern for these young
people because they see

1258.12.text:
these guns coming in
all the time from other states.

1262.56.text:

There's a concept called

1264.56.text:

1266.57.text:

1268.60.text:

The flower pot was the

1271.40.text:

1273.71.text:

1275.71.text:

1277.71.text:

1298.53.text:

1300.53.text:

1304.24.text:

1306.31.text:
that make illegal guns.

1308.84.text:

1312.95.text:

1315.38.text:

1319.62.text:

1323.79.text:

1326.46.text:

so incredible. You know I

1336.27.text:
which was in '69, '65,

which is very important
if you're going to have a gun

1418.62.text:

those names, a lot of

1421.65.text:

1424.56.text:

1427.53.text:

and yet they're against a

1430.46.text:

1438.47.text:
not gun owners?

and Safety Commission?

1445.44.text:
The only one. And guns are
designed to kill people.

1458.79.text:

1506.94.text:
>>>LEAH GUNN BARRETT: We
need better regulations for

1508.94.text:
our gun dealers so that New
York state police for example

1511.94.text:
can inspect them and make sure
they're following federal law.

1514.45.text:
We need a child access
prevention safe storage law

1518.35.text:
at the state level to
prevent suicides, gun thefts and

1521.65.text:
unintentional shootings.
We need microstamping for guns

1526.09.text:
and what that is on the shell
casings that are expended

1529.03.text:
at a crime scene there's
a unique number that is printed

1531.83.text:
on the shell casing from
the firing pin of the gun

1534.13.text:
used that law enforcement
can then take and trace back to

1538.07.text:
the gun, to its original owner,
where it came from to solve

1541.01.text:
gun crimes and yet the N.R.A.
has been standing in the way

1543.61.text:
of that as well. So those are
three things right away I

1546.51.text:
can name. Something else,
which is really interesting,

1548.81.text:
it's called a Gun Violence

1552.25.text:

restraining order and it enables

1555.32.text:
a family member to petition a
judge. If you have someone

1558.39.text:

you know has guns.

1563.33.text:
angry or depressed,

1566.53.text:

1571.70.text:

1574.21.text:

removed, which makes a lot of

1576.71.text:
you sense. So we're going
